body_html:
With this op, it might be easy to implement the gradient of SparseReduceSumSparse.

import tensorflow.contrib.sparse_ops.python.ops.sparse_ops as spops
@ops.RegisterGradient("SparseReduceSumSparse")
def _SparseReduceSumSparseGrad(op, *grads):
    output_tensor = sparse_tensor.SparseTensor(op.outputs[0], grads[1], op.outputs[2])
    input_tensor = sparse_tensor.SparseTensor(op.inputs[0], op.inputs[1], op.inputs[2])

    grad = spops.sparse_tile_like(output_tensor, input_tensor, op.inputs[3]).values

    return (None, grad,
            None, None)

I was wondering if it is proper adding this gradient directly into the contrib package?
body:
With this `op`, it might be easy to implement the gradient of `SparseReduceSumSparse`.

```
import tensorflow.contrib.sparse_ops.python.ops.sparse_ops as spops
@ops.RegisterGradient("SparseReduceSumSparse")
def _SparseReduceSumSparseGrad(op, *grads):
    output_tensor = sparse_tensor.SparseTensor(op.outputs[0], grads[1], op.outputs[2])
    input_tensor = sparse_tensor.SparseTensor(op.inputs[0], op.inputs[1], op.inputs[2])

    grad = spops.sparse_tile_like(output_tensor, input_tensor, op.inputs[3]).values

    return (None, grad,
            None, None)
```

I was wondering if it is proper adding this gradient directly into the `contrib` package?
